required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetic Characteristics of BAT8008 for Injection
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Open Phase I Clinical Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerance, Pharmacokinetics and Initial Efficacy of BAT8008 for Injection in Patients With Advanced Solid Tumor

brief_summary.textblock: Objectives:To evaluate the safety and tolerability of BAT8008 for injection in patients with advanced solid tumors, explore the maximum tolerated dose (MTD), and provide the recommended dose for subsequent clinical trials.

detailed_description.textblock: In this multi-center, open, dose-increasing, dose-expanding Phase I clinical study, rapid titration and a "3+3" dose-increasing design were used to explore the safety, tolerability and PK characteristics of BAT8008 for injection in patients with advanced solid tumors. During the dose-escalation test, appropriate doses were selected for the extended study according to the previous study data.

primary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of Cycle 1( first cycle is 21 days, subsequent cycles are 14 days)
primary_outcome.description: DLT was defined as grade 3 or higher toxicity associated with the investigational product that occurred within 21 days of the subject's initial administration

primary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of Cycle 1( first cycle is 21 days, subsequent cycles are 14 days)
primary_outcome.description: MTD was defined as exploration in a dose group observed ≤1/6 of subjects during the DLT evaluation period to the highest dose level of DLT.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 91 days after first dose of BAT8008
secondary_outcome.description: The area under the concentration-time curve extrapolated from time 0 to infinity

other_outcome.time_frame: 91 days after first dose of BAT8008
other_outcome.description: presence of anti-drug antibody/ nentralizing antibodies

intervention.description: Intravenous infusion, once every 2 weeks (Q2W). It is recommended that the infusion time of the first cycle should be ≥ 3 hours. If no infusion reaction occurs, the subsequent circulation can be completed within 1-2 hours.
intervention.other_name: Recombinant humanized anti Trop2 monoclonal antibody for injection Exetecan conjugate

overall_official.affiliation: Sun Yat-sen Memorial Hospital,Sun Yat-sen University
